instructions:
Create a function that takes any nonnegative number as an argument and return it with it's digits in descending order. Descending order is when you sort from highest to lowest.

Examples

sortDecending(123) ➞ 321

sortDecending(1254859723) ➞ 9875543221

sortDecending(73065) ➞ 76530

Notes

You can expect non-negative numbers for all test cases.
tests:
Test.assertEquals(sortDecending(123), 321)
Test.assertEquals(sortDecending(670276097), 977766200)
Test.assertEquals(sortDecending(2619805), 9865210)
Test.assertEquals(sortDecending(81294), 98421)
Test.assertEquals(sortDecending(0000000), 0000000)
Test.assertEquals(sortDecending(321), 321)
Test.assertEquals(sortDecending(628904), 986420)
Test.assertEquals(sortDecending(289327560), 987653220)
Test.assertEquals(sortDecending(6456), 6654)
Test.assertEquals(sortDecending(444111888555333), 888555444333111)
title: Sort Numbers in Descending Order
